title: It takes you 5 hours to paint a room. Your friend could paint the room in 7 hours. How long would it take you if you worked together? - Quora

response.answer_text: So you can paint 1/5 room per hour, your friend 1/7. Between you you can paint 1/5+1/7=12/35 room/hour, so it takes you 35/12 hours or 2 hours 55 mins. More interestingly this reciprocal of the sum of reciprocals turns up in many places — e.g. the “reduced mass” in the Kepler problem, calculating U-values for multiple glazing, in the reduced variance of the Kalman filter. It's closely related to the “harmonic mean”, a cousin of the standard (arithmetic) mean and the geometric mean.
